result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Eugene Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ALL COUNTS: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

CONCURRENT AS TO EACH COUNT; and any other count or sentence, with 259 days credit as to each count.

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and WI Substance Abuse program after 2 years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Eugene Baker

records.addlTxt: signed by the Court (electronically)

A Petition for Sentence Adjustment was filed with the court.
THE COURT ORDERS:
The Petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
-   The court finds that the full time designated for confinement is necessary to punish and deter the defendant, particularly since the defendant was given an opportunity on extended supervision to conform his conduct and failed to do so. Under the circumstances, it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense if the defendant did not serve 100% of the reconfinement time. 

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Aaron E. Baker - #423152, Jackson Correctional Institution, PO Box 233, Black River Falls WI 54615).

See Wis.Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Christopher Sobic is relieved of any further representation of  Aaron Eugene Baker on appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 259 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 259 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 259 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 2 years confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Aaron Eugene Baker in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Defendant Aaron Eugene Baker in custody.    Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. As to Counts 1, 2 & 3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Jury trial date of 11/02/2015 vacated.
